body.name: Empty Vows
body.description: In this scandalous follow-up to the Depression-era tale Mrs. Wiggins, award-winning and New York Times best-selling author Mary Monroe delivers even more drama to the Deep South, as a proper church-going woman determined to snare Alabama’s most-sought after widower finds his secret desires and righteous lies come as a package deal.... Forty-something widow Jessie Tucker is beloved throughout Lexington, Alabama, for her kind heart and endless generosity. But she feels it's past time she rewarded herself—especially when upstanding Hubert Wiggins tragically loses his wife and son. Making herself indispensable, yet discouraged by Hubert’s lack of romantic interest, Jessie cooks up a deception she knows will make pious Hubert do right by her.... Hoax or not, Hubert couldn’t be happier. The passionate self he’s long hidden from everyone has a new, much-riskier secret love. And the unsuspecting second Mrs. Wiggins will help him maintain his ever-so-devout image in the community.... But when Hubert is not the ardent lover Jessie always dreamed he was, she turns her desires to handsome younger man Conway. Suddenly the “good church wife” can't resist temptation at all. And someone is watching: Conway’s new girlfriend—and Jessie's longtime rival—Blondeen. Now Blondeen has the perfect opportunity to harass Jessie, destroy her reputation, drive her out of town—then become the real wife Hubert should have had all along... In one shattering night, Jessie, Blondeen, and Hubert will each go too far. And when their web of deceit threatens to drag them under for good, they will have only one chance to erase the past and claim everything they've ever wanted. If their secrets don't destroy them first.... Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A great book to read showing how Black people were treated during the Jim Crow era. Separate bathrooms. Separate doors. Blacks had to come through the back door. The main characters were very interesting . Hurburt the widower and Jessie the dead wife’s best friend evidently get married . Huburt has been carring a secret through two volumes so far. Now Jessie and him both have a secret to keep! I can’t wait four the 4 th volume!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Book 2, Sequel to “Mrs. Wiggins”
reviews.reviewText: In this follow-up to “Mrs. Wiggins”, the author picked up right where she left off. Like literally, in the same day of the ending of book 1. I was immediately drawn in by the familiar characters and climate. Set in rural Alabama during the Depression Era, “Empty Vows” interweaves intense plots and drama in such a way that the reader does not have to be a historic fiction fan to enjoy it. Hubert Wiggins is still living a double life and willing to go through great lengths to keep it hidden. Being the most wanted man in his community due to his success, good looks and status in the church, he has lots of women competing for him. Meanwhile black women are being murdered in this small tight knit community by a serial killer and the police force refuse to investigate because … racism. As the story progresses some secrets stay secrets and new secrets are created. It’s a fast and exciting read that took me on an emotional ride. Picked up and started book 3 on the same day that I finished book 2.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This entire series was good! Book 1-3 did not disappoint at all. Mary Monroe never misses in my opinion!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book wasn’t as fast paced as the one before it. Some of the storyline is not believable to me but I’m also looking at things through a modern lens and this is set back in Jim Crow times. I’m planning on reading the third book to see if they can tie up the loose ends

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Empty vows didn't disappoint!
reviews.reviewText: I loved how it picked right up from Mrs. Wiggins. I'm ready for the next one. A definite page turner for sure!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It was a bit far stretched and not as good as the first book- Mrs. Wiggins but it was worth a read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Mary Monroe has done it again! I loved this book! I hate that Hubert had to end up killing Blonde, but he had to protect himself and Jessie. I know Jessie felt stupid confessing to an affair after not having another miscarriage. Lol! Y'all need to read this book! I can't wait to get into the next book!

reviews.reviewTitle: Empty Vows ( Lexington Alabama Novel Book 2)
reviews.reviewText: The 1st book was more exciting and dramatic, anyways this book was like what next it was slow but the story comes . Jessie married her best friend husband never knowing their secret and lies . But hoping in book 3 it will reveal.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Not as riveting as Mrs. Wiggins . But definitely interesting enough to make me want to read the conclusion. The book club reading points were hilarious. All the characters in the story were self centered. Especially Jessie and the plonker , funeral director she chased after. One could forgive Maggie's misdemeanors in the first book. Not terribly sure why a serial killer was included . But definitely want to read the finale

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 9, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This one seems to be all about Hurbert Wiggins a character from the previous book this time there is a serial killer on the loose . Hurbert Will use this to his advantage. No clue who the killer maybe, guess we'll find out in the next novel. Ok read hope there is more "Action" in the next one.
